meanings.definition: A type of pastry or baked good
meanings.sent1: I enjoyed a delicious flawn for dessert.
meanings.sent2: The bakery had a variety of flawns on display.
meanings.sent3: The flawn looked too pretty to eat!
meanings.sent4: The flawn was a work of art on the plate.
meanings.sent5: The sweet aroma of the flawn filled the room.

meanings.definition: To show off or flaunt something in a boastful manner
meanings.sent1: She would always flawn her new jewelry at parties.
meanings.sent2: He liked to flawn his expensive car to impress others.
meanings.sent3: He would flawn his dance moves whenever there was music.
meanings.sent4: She would flawn her achievements like trophies.
meanings.sent5: He would flawn his knowledge in front of everyone.

meanings.definition: A flaw or imperfection in something
meanings.sent1: The painting had a noticeable flawn in the corner.
meanings.sent2: The vase had a small flawn that made it unique.
meanings.sent3: The flawn in the plan actually made it more interesting.
meanings.sent4: The flawn in her argument was hard to ignore.
meanings.sent5: The flawn in the diamond made it stand out.
